abstract: Talks between General Electric and Vivendi over the future of NBC Universal have stalled, with the two sides apparently at least $500 million apart on how to value the network, The New York Times reported Saturday.
snippet: Talks between General Electric and Vivendi over the future of NBC Universal have stalled, with the two sides apparently at least $500 million apart on how to value the network, The New York Times reported Saturday.
lead_paragraph: Talks between General Electric and Vivendi over the future of NBC Universal have stalled, The New York Times’s Andrew Ross Sorkin and Tim Arango reported on Saturday, citing people involved in the discussions who spoke on condition of anonymity because they were part of confidential negotiations.

headline.main: G.E. and Vivendi Halt Talks Over Stake in NBC
